## Quality Checklist

<!-- Ensure your PR meets these quality standards -->

- [ ] No exaggerated claims or unsupported percentages
- [ ] No marketing language (e.g., "revolutionary", "game-changing")
- [ ] Technical accuracy maintained
- [ ] Clear and concise documentation
- [ ] Follows existing code style and patterns
- [ ] No increase in maintenance burden

## Technical Standards

<!-- For code changes, verify these points -->

- [ ] No unsupported performance claims (e.g., "95% success rate")
- [ ] Uses "Recommended" instead of "Ideal" or "Perfect"
- [ ] Uses "Minimal" instead of "0 hours/year"
- [ ] No template-based approaches (EDAF is self-adapting)
- [ ] Maintains language/framework agnostic design
